review: I have been here a couple of times and each time, the food has been very good.  I have had the BBQ Chicken Pizza, a couple of the salads, and one of their pasta dishes.  All were very good, made from scratch with fresh ingredients.  The service is average for this type of place. The prices are on the high side, but for the quality of the food, I think it is worth it.

I received a postcard in the mail from  , advertising $10 off my first order. I immediately went to   to see what restaurants they served were in my area. CPK was on the list, and that meant I could get a meal from CPK for 6 bucks. Not bad, not bad. I submitted my online order through   (which was anything but a seamless process) and selected my CPK order for pick-up. My e-mail confirmation said I should expect my order  to be ready in 20-25 minutes. I probably left my house about 35 minutes after I placed my order. When I finally arrived home with my pizza, after a 5 minute walk to and from CPK each way, my pizza was cold. What? Do you guys not have a pizza warmer to keep my pizza warm while you wait for me to pick it up? I know most people eat inside the restaurant, so this isn't necessary for most people, but you do offer carry-out. Sorry everyone can't be there the second the pizza comes out of the oven. When I think about the 5 people I saw in the restaurant when I went to go pick up my order, I assume my order was made in 15 minutes, max. My pizza was probably sitting on the counter for 20-30 minutes. Isn't that nice.

Came for lunch on Saturday & had Lateenya as our server. She was the best! She was very attentive & made sure we were happy. The food was delicious too. We tried the carnita tacos, fish tacos, & penne pesto pasta. All tasty & flavorful. We will come back for sure!

Overall, good food, fresh ingredients, very California. Everything could go with a little more spice, or at least some choices on the table (like red pepper flakes, hot sauce) BUT... Considering  the prices...   eg $9 for a glass of Santa Marguerita Pinot Grigio, $15 for a very modest sized Asian Salad - I think it's very pricey, especially since the atmosphere is big chain, and the service is okay... Just okay. The pizza is good, not great. Crust a little too sweet, and we didn't even have the whole wheat crust. I would go again if I was famished and shopping nearby and there was no line. Otherwise, I'd pick another place.

I usually have a pretty satisfying experience at any CPK that I've tried (Honolulu, Omaha, NYC, Arlington).  I met up with a friend from home at this location.  It was around 8 pm on a weekday and the restaurant wasn't very busy.  The food was delicious as usual (I got a BBQ chicken pizza - always a safe bet), but the service was just okay.  We received our food within 15 minutes of placing our order but the waitress seemed like she was ready to clock out.  Overall the experience was okay.

I've ordered online and walked over here to pickup my order and never had any issues, the to go people are situated on the side of the bar and it's a bit awkward waiting for your turn when servers are speed walking around you. The food is always ready on time and they usually ask if you would like any bread with your meal. CPK has always been a bit on the pricey side for a chain but it's decent food and you can get a pretty solid salad. Their new menu has really expanded the flavors available.  Check it out, you can't go wrong!
Love this location.  Servers were great.  New small plates menu is amazing.  Made a meal out of two of them.  It's the perfect end to a great shopping trip to Pentagon City Mall.

This location seems to be the off-site cafeteria for the DEA and TSA ... Lots of .Gov bling and ID badges hanging out.  Given the general level of discontent folks have with both agencies, maybe this is a good location to avoid?  Just saying ... :) I only order off the appetizer menu at CPK, I find the place a bit $pendy.  I recently ordered the guac/chips and the arugala salad here.  Spot on, tasty.  Service was sloooooooooooooow, but polite.  Solid meal from a chain.

Consistently awesome. Outstanding service, fresh food,  and great menu.  We leave here smiling every time, even if it is just a to go order. Great place to go when you need a quick dinner and don't want to cook. Seriously, we have had fantastic and friendly service every time.

Not a good meal.  Hubby had salmon and it was okay.  The pasta was hard and lukewarm.  The asparagus was cold.  I had steak tacos.  Not good.  Can't explain why.  Just wasn't good.  The chips were stale and the salsa blah and bland   Hubby's Cosmo was good.  My mango mango mojito was okay.  We will not be going back even though we got two more Thank You cards.  To make matter worse, we has to pay for one hour of parking even with a validated ticket.
Price is reasonable and quality is great. Like BBQ chicken pizza.

Do not I repeat do not come here btw 1130 and 130 for lunch. Been here on 3 occasions just to test my theory. The first time I waited 39 mins for my food AFTER I ordered it. The second time I sent my food back cause it was cold. I waited a total of 46 minutes before I ate. The third time was a joke. Long story short, we left to eat somewhere else because the food took so long. Here's the kicker...all 3 times I ordered a ceasar salad! Really!!! Over 30 min for a salad.

White corn guacamole and chips and BBQ chicken pizza delish!  I went during lunch hour or a Friday.  That instance was not as slow as I read in other reviews for lunch time.  Service time and staff seemed ok.   I've only been there during lunch and it always seems like I just paid way to much for lunch.  I return time and time again...clearly worth it.
We went here yesterday and everything was good! The Italian sodas were great with refills, we tried every flavor!!!!!

I knew the quality of service I would receive after dining at a NYC CPK location. I ordered the bbq chicken pizza and a strawberry lemonade which did not disappoint my palette. I received my meal and drink pretty quickly and it was delicious. I'm still a fan.
Had the pest chicken pizza and the Bbq chicken pizza.  Both excellent, tad small for the price.  Service was great, quick and accurate.

The food was delicious and the waitress was very polite. They actually gave us a thin crust instead of original. The manager came out minutes later apologized and said he was putting in the correct order. They told us to keep both pizzas.  They were so kind and apologetic. It only took 5 min before the order was ready. I will definitely come back again.

I haven't eaten at this CPK in a while, but it's definitely changed.  The food is still outstanding, but the menu is much smaller, there's not as many waitstaff as I've seen previously, and there's been no wait whatsoever for a table with the two times I've eaten lunch there over the past two weeks.  On previous visits with a party of two or four, I've waited 10-30 minutes for a table to clear.  Another reviewer mentioned about the long wait for your food order.  They are absolutely right, but there's also equally long waits to get waited on and to get your bill paid.

I'm an Italian chopped salad addict (without the meat) and this location always has good, fresh, ingredients.  Very reliable for all your favorite CPK menu items, and it's got a lot of tables so you usually don't have a wait to be seated.  Very satisfied with this CPK - try to go every time I'm in town.

They have many special dishes like Kong Pao Spaghetti, Carnitas Pork pizza, which we ordered. Tasted good.  On the menu I also saw some other dishes I would like to try next time like Thai pizza, fish tacos etc.

"you'd think that a  pizza restaurant would be able to cook a proper pizza" Food: 2/5 Service: 5/5 Atmosphere: 3/5 Parking: 1/5 Cleanliness: 4/5        We came here as two veterans to take advantage of a free pizza day for veterans (which I thank California PIzza Kitchen for) however, after ordering 3 very different pizzas to share, all three were just OK.... almost frozen-pizza like in their texture, very little seasoning, and uneventful, as well as corporate cost-saving tricks like the obviously bagged, pre-cut cheese, processed meats, and dried mixed seasoning powder - not at all a from scratch recipe, but rather highly corporate (the reason I avoid most chain restaurants)          The service here was friendly, prompt, and professional - didn't miss a beat. I can't help but comment, however, that it's strange that it seemed that whoever does the hiring here is only interested in hiring an army of young, in shape, and very attractive people, check and see for yourself, it's odd but not necessarily a complaint.          The atmosphere was, again, highly corporate. You could tell that the decorations were there to match every other location as all chain restaurants do and therefore not offer to the local community something new, vibrant, and unique.           To conclude, I do not plan on returning. I can get the best pizza in Alexandria at Valentino's.

I probably won't come here again. Not because the food was bad or because the service was bad, but just because thee food was very uninspired. I had good memories of this place, but now I'm not sure what I saw in it. The 2 things that I found slightly disappointing were the bread that was offered and my speciality coffee. The bread was 3 slices of Italian bread with some individually wrapped Land'O'Lakes. I expected something a little more interesting like a small loaf of bread or nice rolls, with olive oil to dip in or something. The expensive coffee was supposed to come with whipped cream but didn't, and that was after they brought me a plain coffee instead of the specialty. Again there was nothing bad just very boring.
Interesting Mac and Cheese appetizer. Service slow, pizza ok.
Chain restaurant. Service was good, food was served as expected.  I would come again. But nothing exciting going on here food wise or any other wise.

Decided to go for some pizza and drinks on a Friday night with a friend. As you would expect the place was alive and busy. Thankfully we didn't have to wait for a table and were immediately seated.  We ordered mojitos, spinach dip, the tortilla soup and a pear and gorgonzola pizza. Our mojitos, dip, and soup came in a timely manner. The drinks were good as was the dip. The tortilla soup however was a little gross. It tasted like heated enchilada sauce with a mound of melted cheese. Probably will never get that again, but what do you expect when you're ordering soup from a chain restaurant? We had to wait for a very long time for our pizza. People that came in after us got theirs first. The kitchen might have forgotten about our order. The waitress made up for it with her kindness though. She seemed sincerely sorry that we had to wait and kept checking in on us to make sure we were okay.  When the pizza finally did come it was yummy as always. When it came time to pay we were pleasantly surprised by  the waitress when she informed us that the manager took care of the pizza for us because we had to wait for such a long time. We didn't even ask for this, we generally understand that people make mistakes. Lessons learned are to stick to pizza when going to a pizza place and that you can still get great and attentive service even at a busy chain. Will definitely be going back when the mood for pizza strikes.

We went to dinner here tonight.  The meal was pretty average and met my relatively high expectations of this chain.  I had the California Club pizza and thought it was pretty good.  I liked the avocados and my wife loved the lettuce.  We also had the Fish Taco but thought that was pretty ordinary.  The taste of the fish was overwhelmed by the other ingredients. The decor was pretty good too.
I love the pizzas and salads but hate eating inside because of the loud music.

...a 4 because the service could've been a little better, definitely not horrible or anything.  Haven't been to CPK in a while but I've always loved it.  I had the Kung Pao Spaghetti with chicken and shrimp and it was soooo good.  Just the right combination of flavors... Sweet and spicy, maybe I liked it soo much Bc I'm Asian! Hahaha kidding, kinda.  I had the tiramisu for dessert which was yummy as always but I can eat one of those frozen tiramisu dessert things an think its fab! The person I was with had the infamous butter cake and it was really good... Like pound cake and cornbread mixed in one! Anyways... It was a lovely lunch minus the so-so service. My tummy is happy.

I'm a bigger fan of the pastas and salads than the pizzas.   One thing about these guys is that they are very professional.  The restaurant, the staff runs very well. Pizzas...meh....other stuff.  danged good.

I lived in Italy for years, and the pizza at CPK is lousy.  I can't believe how bad it was.  I went with other people and so I tried 3 different kinds of pizza.  The only good part was that the meat on the Sicilian pizza was high-quality.  I've never had "bad" pizza, kind of like I've never had "bad" ice cream, but compared to other pizzas, I don't like the CPK.  I'm only giving it 2 stars (instead of one star) because all pizza is good, even though this pizza is on the bottom end of the scale.  The location in Arlington is great and the staff was friendly.  The product was just well below average.

I hated not liking it. I've been a fan when I was in San Jose, tried it here with excitement, a complementary avocado/ corn salad and tortilla chips was great, caesar salad was good, I headed for the BBQ chicken pizza, the dough was too sweet that it made me sad. Imagine barbecue sauce as a salty catalyst to the sugary dough =/
Great location, friendly staff. Easy to use frequent buyer program (I signed up while waiting for my food to arrive).

Jamaican jerk chicken pizza and ask for balsamic vinaigrette on the side plus the caramelized pear salad. Delicious!! I rate this CPK 4 stars because the service was great and the pizza was good.  If I was rating food alone, it would be 3 stars.

I am from California, so I LOVE CPK.  But I had to give this one just 3 stars, because the experience differs every time.  Sometimes very good, sometimes not so good.  For example - I got the California Club pizza a few days ago.  The service was great, but the pizza crust was completely overcooked.  It actually crumbled while I ate it.   On the flip side, I ordered the Tostada pizza (my favorite!!) a few months ago - and it was perfect.  I've been there several times, and that's been my experience - sometimes, just right, sometimes completely off.  The service has always been consistently very good, though.  And you can't beat the prices for gourmet pizzas.

Do you know what's a terrible idea? Inviting FORTY plus people to lunch and trying to cram them all at one extra long table during the lunch rush hour. Do you know what's worse? Being the party sitting next to these forty plus people and constantly getting dirty looks because you have the nerve to take space away from such a ridiculous soiree (seriously folks, if you have forty people you need to feed, rent out a banquet hall! And please CPK, for the sake of all other folks dining, have the decency to say that you can't accommodate such a large party, I mean, unless they want to rent out the entire restaurant!).  Outside of that, our waitress was great and the manager was very attentive and tried her best to make sure we were comfortable. I ordered the California Club pizza and that is definitely my new favorite. It was delicious!  I won't hold CPK responsible for the shortsightedness of other folks, so I'll definitely return.

This place never fails to offer fresh food, the pizza is to our taste and the fresh salads and appetizers always go down well. The service is good but not too cloying like some places that constantly ask you *Are you ok?* Trust me if I am not ok you are going to hear about it! They are very accommodating with taking the pizza out if you cant finish it, which we often do as then we get to have an appetizer and the butter cake... the only thing better than the pizza at this place is the butter cake. So when you go first try the pizza and then try the butter cake, if you don't have any kind of sweet tooth then try the wraps appetizer.

At first sight a little excitement withered away. I took a bite and instantly became sad. This is the worst pizza i've ever tasted. doughy, undercooked, bland sauce and tasteless meat. i should have gotten a frozen pizza from target, i like those.

I sure wish we lived closer to CPK.  We used to order from CPK all the time when we lived closer to one in another state.  It's a favorite of our family.   This particular location does not disappoint.  The staff has always bent over backwards for us to make us feel welcome and treat us with the utmost professionalism and courtesy.  The food is absolutely extraordinary.  I crave it.  My current favorite is the habanero carnitas pizza.  Whenever we go into DC for a special event, we usually plan the trip to include a stop at CPK on our way into the city.
The thin crust pizzas are good.  Very wide choice of toppings. Usually pretty good about serving quickly during lunch hour.
Both appetizer plates on the table were dirty and had food residue on them. $9 tortilla spring rolls were TINY and boring. BF's meat pizza was barely even lukewarm. No thanks.
Great experience on veteran's day.  They were very welcoming and offered free pizza for veterans.  The pizza was unique and delicious.

This place does not even deserve ONE single star from me. The manager needs to learn how to talk to his customers in a polite manner. The food was not even that great and the cooks do not even wear gloves to cook the food.. gross

I usually don't write reviews for chains. I had to stop in here because I was starving and Pent City isn't exactly a hip dining mecca, and what I saw merited immediate review. I am by no means a germaphobe, but what I saw while I dined at the bar in front of the open kitchen was appalling. I saw cooks with visibly dirty hands touching their hair and biting their nails directly before touching food to prepare. I watched as they texted and played with their phones--the most germy item you will touch in the day--without washing their hands. I brought it to the attention if the manager, who apologized but did nothing to make up for my horror. No comps, no free drink, nothing. Definitely will not come back.

So you want designer pizza? You want to go where the adults eat? You want to watch TV too ? Then this is your place. But warnings are here as well. I entered and was promptly and pleasantly addressed. Even on this busy Friday evening, service was brisk. I had three different menus: drink, full, and specials. Unfortunately my waiter had to deal with multiple special requests from neighboring tables and this meant less than great service for me. He forgot a straw for my drink and the bread and olive oil.  Refills were almost too slow. And yes you will want all of these "services"..  I ordered the Jerk Chicken pizza. It has a thin crisp crust. The center was a bit soggy and the pizza is very sweet. So if you select this pizza, dessert will not be necessary. This pizza was listed as a restaurant favorite, so I had high expectations. When the chicken is rubbery, I am not inclined to believe them. The mediocre food and service result in three stars. I had a gift card, so it was worth the price. If you receive a gift card, I suggest you try this place. If you don't, then travel elsewhere.

We went to California pizza kitchen to grab a late lunch/early dinner. The place was half- empty but still we had to wait for a few minutes to get a table.  I was very surprised with the quality of the food. We had a Hawaiian pizza and a lettuce wrap with shrimp. Very reasonable prices for the quality of the food.   Unfortunately I can't say the same about the service. The service is slow. Extremely slow!  I would probably understand if they were packed, but they were not.  Definitely won't come back, even for a good pizza.   Well, may be a carry out would be a better option...

I've been to CPK's in several states over more than a decade and this location is Dreadful - go anywhere else, there are plenty of eateries in walking distance.   1) Service - no one at the host stand on arrival and when someone did show up we were shown to a table without a word. Our server was also nearly mute and never checked on the food or refilled the soda. 2) Food -  This is California PIZZA Kitchen for goodness sake, a formulaic process that should not end up in HALF the pizza (the entire center) soggy and cool.  Once I cut out the wet center which was too gummy to eat there was little left except crust - a "new recipe" that is not an improvement.   I ate what I could of the soggy salty pizza when I could not find anyone to wave down, our "server" having vanished.  This was not a busy weeknight and the food and service unacceptable.

The first time I had ever tried this place was when I was in Dallas, and it was a great experience then.  Needless to say, I was stoked to check out this location, because we already had plans to do some shopping in the nearby mall.  I think their pizzas are something unique, and they offer different combinations in terms of toppings.  The bread and salads are also quite and good and the portions are more than what you would expect.  It appeared that they also had several types of beverages to offer.  My favorite was the peach tea! Our waiter was on top of his game.  He gave us a lot of information about the vegetarian pizza, as well as, spinach artichoke dip that he recommended as an appetizer.  We could tell right away that he had been working there a while.  Our drinks were refilled fast, our table was wiped and cleaned ahead of time, and the food came out right on time.  Everyone who helped us was very friendly and conscientious.  I think it's a great place to eat and the location can't be beat!

This place is the best. The sangria are delicious and the pizzas are great. I'll be coming hungry and thirsty to enjoy the amazing pizza and awesome sangrias. Keep up the good work guys. Well run business.
Excellent place! Their sangrias are the best! We would sometimes go there for dinner or order food delivery from them and my experience was always positive so far!
Love their BBQ Chicken Chop Salad. I would have given a higher grade if their carry out service would have been better. Slow and unorganized.
Walked up to the front host area to get seated and stood there for 5 min without anyone acknowledging me and my boyfriend were there lol so decided to go to Chevys fresh mex instead!!

The first time I tried this place it was pretty decent, so I suggested going there when a friend and I were heading out to lunch. The service overall was fairly poor. Most of the time our server was nowhere to be found even though we waived other servers down to go and find her. Only was she really around when it was time to pick up the check. As for the food, I got a turkey, brie, and pear sandwich with a side salad. The salad was decent but had barely enough dressing to cover even half of it. For the sandwich, both my friend's and mine came out with wet, soggy bread. My turkey sandwich sounds like it would be good by the description, but it was sloppily made and they put some odd, watery honey mustard in it that ruined the overall taste. The only good thing about this place is that it's cheap. But other than that, I won't ever go back.

I love California pizza Kitchen and this experience was nothing different then the experiences I have had back home in Jacksonville, Florida. When my group got to the restaurant, it was packed but we were sat within 15 minutes. It was a pleasant surprise since I thought we would be waiting for over 30 minutes. I ordered a strawberry lime margarita and is was amazing. I then ordered a white pizza with mushrooms and it was awesome!! One of my group members has to eat gluten free and ordered from the gluten free menu and really enjoyed their dish. The waitress was extremely efficient and our drinks never were empty and our food came out piping hot. Would go back here again when back in the area.

I decided to go here for dinner since I didn't want to cook, #lazy, and wanted something light. So I took a stroll to the CPK and decide to order some small plates, I ordered Spicy chicken Tinga quesadilla, Asparagus Arugula Salad, and White Corn Guacamole and chips. Be warned the small plate means small plate. The Spicy chicken Tinga quesadilla and White Corn Guacamole and chips where just ok, I wouldn't order it again. The Asparagus Arugula Salad was the star of the meal it was refreshing and I would definitely order it again. I learned it is probably best to order pizza and the Asparagus Arugula Salad the next time I go to CPK.

MISS ALL THE WAY!!! If CFK was a airplane it wood be in the water. Yes I gave them another try. No it's not like the Chef (Movie title)  Here my review. It was Sunday after church I waited for my brother and have some thing to eat. Almost when to Chevy but end up coming here. I didn't order the soup or Appetizer because I had some Frap at Starbucks.  Both of us order the  PESTO CREAM PENNE Freshly mad basil pesto cream sauce with sun-dried tomatoes and Parmesan.  But we wanted with angel hair pasta instead. Before for I place the order. I ask had I had you before that you service me. She answer the think slice avocado. It should have been a red light for me. But I wanted to have dinner with my brother. We end up having them serve us and ask more basil pesto cream sauce on the side. It was dry and under cook pasta. My brother only eaten have and taken it home. They didn't have plastic bag. I end up asking my brother are you going to eat it. NO end up leaving it at the table. Another reason I order this I got Dave and Buster with CFK. Wish I had that place here. P.S. I saw the waitress that service us before and stay away from us. Pentagon Centre lost two customer. Hope Tyson's fear better with prize to win a $1,000 only thing the manager has to open the ticket to see the prize.

There's a CPK on the East Coast!!! Yes, yes, yes.  As a California native, I am absolutely in love with California Pizza Kitchen.  I used to visit the Westwood location in LA at least once a month for about four years.  The pizza is always excellent.  When I learned that there was one somewhat nearby, I jumped at the opportunity to both visit and introduce my darling bf (a native East Coaster) to the wonder that is CPK.  I ended up loving this restaurant.  Perhaps it's part nostalgia, but my bf agreed - the food was very good.  We both ordered pizzas - I ordered the Spicy Chipotle Chicken (Chipotle adobo sauce, shaved poblanos, Monterey jack, with housemade roasted corn and black bean salsa, cilantro, lime crema) and my boyfriend ordered the California Club (applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken, mozzarella, hearth-baked, then topped with avocado, arugula, torn basil, and Romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayonnaise).  Both pizzas were delicious and the portions were very large - we had plenty of leftovers. What I love about CPK is their extensive menu (pizza, pasta, soup, salad, entrees, tacos, desserts, etc) and their unique topping creations.   We also got margaritas, which were very refreshing during the hot summer evening.  The service was great throughout. No complaints at all!  We will certainly be back :)

CPK isn't usually my go to restaurant, but occasionally they have something slightly different from Applebees or TGI Fridays that will make me opt to come here. I ordered their four cheese ravioli because I was craving a non meat product, and they delivered exactly what I wanted. It was a very satisfying dish. The server forgot I'd ordered an iced tea and never brought it, but since it wasn't put on the tab either, no harm was done. Their mac n cheese small dish is also delicious. Great location right across the street from Pentagon City Mall, right next to the Pentagon City metro stop, walking distance to Crystal City.

It looked like a quick stop for a decent meal and carb load before the big race and....it was. :) Very much like any number of restaurants in the same genre, food tasted decent, service was good, price reasonable.  I wouldn't knock myself out to find one in PA but if I was hungry, and saw one, I would stop.

We went here on Veteran's Day because they do a special menu for service members and my fiancé was able to get a free regular size pizza. He opted for the BBQ Chicken and raved about it. I thought it was pretty good as well. It was nice that they don't alter the size for the free special. I tried the flatbread with mushrooms and it was crispy which I liked but it lacked a little flavor. We also sat at the bar and the bartender wasn't the most friendly at first but ended up warming up to us.  This place gets 4 stars for the Veteran's Day special and their BBQ chicken pizza.

20 years ago, California Pizza Kitchen was the best, but nowadays, something just tastes different. It's hard to pinpoint what's changed, but overall eating here has a very "corporate" taste that doesn't strike me as particularly fresh or flavorful. There's an open kitchen, but either this was the quietest kitchen ever, or there wasn't a ton of cooking going on, leading me to wonder if a lot of what they serve arrives pre-cooked. Hmmmm.  My pizza was perfectly edible, but perfectly blah. Plus, the pizzas are pretty small for being almost $14. I wanted to try some appetizers, but they were sent back because they arrived after our pizzas, a full 45 minutes after arriving and when other people around us, who were seated after us, were getting their checks and leftovers packaged up. Service was really lacking, from the no-greeting hostess who seemed totally stressed out, to our well-meaning but frazzled waiter who admitted it was his first day and that he "wasn't mean't to serve."

I'm not a fan of huge chain restaurants but this franchise has always pleased. I go back for the comfortable ambiance, delicious food and decent service. I'm a bug fan of the jambalaya, the shrimp scampi, and of course the meat cravers.  For dessert,  the butter cake was a true surprise. Warm, rich and delicious. I also get an apple martini when I go. I just really enjoy this spot!

After having a not so good first experience the manager Edie, made it right by inviting my family back to try again. The complimentary bread was hot and fresh, the olive oil and herb dip they use is very flavorful and fresh. I also recommend the apple berry sangria, yum. We ordered an appetizer this time the spinach and artichoke dip was excellent. There's a lot of ways to mess up this appetizer but CPKs is on-point. The waitress was extremely professional. Every time she passed by she asked if we needed anything and refilled the soft drinks very timely. We ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza, The works pizza, bolognese spaghetti, and chicken and shrimp fettuccine. All the food was very fresh and delivered hot to the table. Which was a big change from our first visit. This meal definitely made up for the bad experience on our first visit. The atmosphere was nice, observing the servers around us was great, and seeing the manager on the floor actively engaged with staff and customers was refreshing. I think we will be back. We got our fill and we're happy with the service we received this time around.

DO NOT FUNDRAISE HERE!  Or if you do, prepare to micromanage. I recently planned and hosted a fundraiser at this location.  I spent a month planning before the event and another month after the event awaiting information about the fundraiser.  As I type this in retrospect, I should have been bothering the coordinator, by phone, every day, about details.  However, as a busy person, I was just hoping she'd uphold her side of the deal and do what she said she would.  My fundraising deadline passed and, while the money will still go to charity, I might as well have not even bothered, because they didn't process anything in time. I am really embarrassed to tell my friends that attended the fundraiser that their dinners did not help my fundraising efforts.  I regret that I trusted CPK to be on top of it, and I hate to think that if I had been more diligent in micromanaging, I could have gotten the fundraising money I was hoping for.

My husband loves this place for lunch on the go.  Since we were in the area, we stopped in for dinner on Sunday. Surprisingly the menu was vast for a pizza place.  Service was a little slow, but not horrible. My daughter ordered the kids pizza.  Her order was incorrect, but she kept it because it was still good. My husband has this sausage flatbread appetizer that was really yummy. He also ordered a spicy black bean type pizza.  The chicken on it was good. I had the shrimp scampi w/ zucchini and fettuccini.  I would have loved this dish if I didn't have to take the shells off the tails.  Also, the zucchini soaked up entirely too much lemon, which made them too sour and tangy to eat once the noodles were gone. Not bad, not great.  I would go again if I am in the area.

We went there after walked around the city in cold. Every memu are a little bit expensive but ok. We ordered "the work" pizza for share (didn't a lot appetited) it tasted good if u like a thin pizza .... try the frozen lemonade is awesome.

This is a go-to restaurant for my wife and I. We have been here plenty of times and usually have a very good experience (hence the rating). The past two times, however, we've had to wait a considerable amount of time for someone at the front of the house to even acknowledge us. All the while plenty of staff members have walked by and even made eye contact with us. That being said, the food here is always great and the wait staff is usually pretty on point. Four of out five for the quality food but (occasional) dip in service quality.
Expensive for pizza that taste like coming out of a box. Tried the Gorgonzola and pears pizza and the only good thing was the pears. The salad uses cheap ingredients. Not worth the visit.
Food was good but pricey. Service was sooo slow. Waitress was inattentive. Probably not coming back at least for a while.

Haven't given a 5-star rating in a while on here and this ones worth it. Our waiter (Shawnda) was kind, attentive to our edible needs, thoughtful in how we wanted to pace our date, and authentic in her care of the service she provided us. Plus, she suggested our meal for the night without being prompted. A real waitress! Gah, ya don't get that in restaurants like this too often. I mean... You want someone who knows the menu, knows how to pace guests, and knows how to share their personality without being inauthentic. I appreciate how she served us tonight and THAT deserves to be recognized via with her manager or on here. I chose here for now.

I can't believe that this was my first experience at CPK.  From California and waited until I got to DC. Staff and Barbara our waitress is awesome , very friendly. the food is great. I'm having taco carnitas and its very good. Family had pizza and chicken piccata which is fabulous!

Went in on a slow Sunday afternoon with the restaurant at 50% occupancy. Didn't have to wait too long to be seated, but there were 4 empty tables in front of us, so I'm not sure why we waited at all to be seated at one of them. We ordered a pizza and a full-size entree chicken salad. The salad came first, with--and I am not exaggerating--1 tablespoon of chicken on it. The pizza came 25 MINUTES LATER and wasn't even hot like it had just come out of the oven. (Remember, there weren't many people in the restaurant.) Mojito didn't taste very good either. Not a good experience here.
This is the worst place to eat  I don't recommend this place to eat the food is nasty and the service is worst  specially the manager  she need to now how to treat the customer !

This place is a go-to for me and the family and it never disappoints. The food is always on point, there's more than just pizza, and the drinks are excellent. Even when it's crowded (and it often is full when I go), we've never had to wait an unreasonable amount of time and the service is stellar.

My family and I came to CPK the other day and it was a great experience. This wasn't our first time coming here. Let me just point out that our server, Dina, made the experience that much better. She was quick, sweet, and knew her stuff. I haven't seen excellent service like that in awhile. I will definitely be returning and requesting for Dina from now on!  Food was excellent - kids pizzas came out first and my and my wife's came out not that much longer after. I decided to try the Jamaican Jerk for the first time and I'm glad I did! I wouldn't have given my experience a 5 if it wasn't for the service. Thank you, Dina!

Ok so currently 5 months pregnant and I ordered the Caramelized Peach Salad which looks amazing and 2 bites in I realized I was eating blue/Gorgonzola cheese which is not safe for pregnant women to eat unless it is 100% pasteurized. I freak out! I call over the hostess and ask if it is pasteurized or unpasteurized and she goes to the back to ask. I'm getting worried sick that I might have harmed the baby with bacteria, already over worried mommy here?! Then my server Nicolette comes over and I explain to her too and she runs to the back to ask and in 5 minutes I had a new menu to pick something else because turns out it was pasteurized but I decided with the hostesses help to be safe and have something completely different. In the next 5 minutes I had my new salad, roasted veggie with salmon, which the manager brought to me! He apologized and was so nice about it! Both the server Nicolette and the hostess came over twice to check on me and apologized sincerely too. I'm so happy with the service here I will make sure to tell everyone!!
Pretty good. I carry out most of the time. The young lady who is always at the carry out counter is really cool. She knows my order ( I always get the same thing) and I get the best service.

The pizza is really bad for a pizza place. I think they changed the overall recipe recently, as I recall a childhood with delicious pizza from CPK. Service was subpar. Waitress never refilled waters until we were heading out. Food was not hot... Lukewarm is being generous. Won't go back. Wouldn't recommend.

They served me nasty rubbery chicken in my salad that had the texture of a car tire.  I think it's just this location.  Ate at the Fairfax location like 50 times and never had an issue.  Service also isn't as good here.   Also, the comped me the price of my chicken but I still got to pay for a bowl of lettuce.   They need new management.

I really wanted to like this place. My boyfriend took me here for the first time, raving about how good the pizza was when he was a kid (and he is a pizza snob.) Yet, service was awful, didn't get a water refill until we were paying our bill, the server argued with us about a coupon we had, initially rejecting it because it was expired, until I found proof it was still valid, at which she rolled her eyes and stalked off with my phone.  During the long stretches of waiting for our food, we saw the place wasn't even that crowded, it appeared a lot of chit chat was going on between servers. When our pizzas came out, they looked very pretty. Asthetically speaking that is. Mine was mushroom and white, his was five cheese and pepperoni. They were borderline COLD. Like they had been sitting out on the counter for 15 minutes before being brought to us (speculation) and the mac and cheese balls brought out 15 min later were the same. Cold. The waitress did not check on us and only asked how the food was when she brought out the mac and cheese balls.  Upon this experience, wouldn't return. Ever.
After a long flight from Seattle the pizza hit the spot.  Good service and close to the Residence Inn at Pentagon City.

Sandy and Yeni served us while here in DC at the california pizza kitchen..  The food was great.  The service was awsome.  The place was clean.  We all enjoyed our food.  Yani is a new employee and she did a great job serving us.  Thank you CPK.
Decent food looks clean but I saw a huge roach in the bathroom. If the bathroom isn't clean you can bet the kitchen is bad.

Just visited this location with my daughter and the service was absolutely impeccable! Waiters were very helpful and nice. You can definitely see the difference of service here compared to other places. Very happy with the food as well! :)
Great service, my pasta could have had more flavor. The shrimp scampi my daughter had was delicious!
My friend and I waited to be served for more than 15 minutes nobody was nice enough to come and take Our order so we left the resturant with our empty stomach.

Stopped in for a light snack...ordered a quesadilla. I guess there was a typo on the menu, because what they brought was more like a quesadilla molecule. My high school chemistry is a little rusty at this point, so I don't know exactly how much a mole is any more - is it about 6.02 x 10 to the 27th? Anyway, I think if you put together about that many of these things, you might have a whole quesadilla.  The service could have been better, too.
Only so-so. I've have much better pizza and service. The cooks are laughing and joking throwing food around. Don't think I will be back.
We were seated right away. Then no one came by for 25 minutes. We left and ate somewhere else. The place was empty.

Food is subpar and cold but in addition to that, the service was less than adequate.  I sat at my table for a long while before my server finished up her chit chat to inconvenience herself by coming over to help me.  She apologized to me and made it up to me by letting me sit dying of thirst for several minutes. Then she REALLY OUTDID herself by ringing me up wrong :-/ Not a good experience

I go to this place because it's one of my go-to spots for lunch. I only go if Yanis is there working the bar. She always gives the best service, makes sure my food comes out fast, and knows the menu very well. Any other time I go there and Yanis is not there I get cups that are not clean, slow service, and overall the experience is not pleasant. I love cpk's food. They are always updating their menu to provide new flavors.

Although the customer service at the take out window was great, and they had just had an exceptionally large group of teenagers in the restaurant before I arrived to pickup my order, the experience I had with the food at this location can't be attributed to any of those factors  I ordered chicken wraps, a garlic chicken pizza and a piece of key lime pie to take back to my hotel, which was literally five minutes away. The weather was fair, so I'm positive the walk had nothing to do with the food quality either.  The meat for the lettuce wraps was hot and tasty and about what you'd expect for a dish like this. The top leaf of lettuce for the wraps was crisp and green, however, every leaf below was brown and beginning to wilt. It made the dish very unappetizing, and I ended up throwing the lettuce away and eating the meat on its own.  The pizza was extremely cold and scarce on toppings. I believe I counted four scraps of chicken on the pizza as a whole, and it was as cold as might have been expected if I had left it out on the counter for an hour or more prior to eating it. Yet, it was the pizza that was supposedly holding up my order and forcing me to wait 15 minutes longer than the time I was told the order could be picked up when I made it online.  The one saving grace to the meal was the key lime pie, which is one of my favorites. The cream for the topping of it was fresh, and the pie itself was light and not overly sweet. It was the one meal item that I did throughly enjoy and felt lived up to the menu's description.  I travel to DC regularly and am unsure if I'll give this California Pizza Kitchen another shot. It's a chain I've never been hesitant to dine at before, but if I'm going to spend $32 on a meal, I'd like to at least feel like I'm getting my money's worth. I definitely can't say that was the case this time around.  Again, I want to stress that the customer service and attitude of the gentleman working at the take out counter was fantastic, and I didn't actually feel slighted as a customer until I went to eat my dinner. That being said, great customer service and great food should go hand-in-hand at a restaurant. I just have say that wasn't the case at this California Pizza kitchen location.

Best service! The assistant GM was super sweet and made sure that we were satisfied with everything! The margarita pizza and the Waldorf salad were the meals served for the make a wish foundation lunch and they were spectacular! The staff is really great and would def recommend anyone to come here!!
Had a great pizza and salad for lunch. I had plain cheese pizza and a Mediterranean salad. The sauce on the pizza was tasty, and the salad was fresh. The service was excellent. Highly recommend

Awful server we had a great meal , the server was really mean and I can tell her look was so judgmental since we start ordering she try to get us everything to make the bill high I don't have any problem with getting food but when we ask for a bill I put 10% tip which she was complaining why I put 10% in front of my guests and she turn her back on me  which it was so rude that was my third time I been there and I will never go there anymore

GROSS FILTHY DISGUSTING VOMIT substance folded into my takeout pasta. It's cream fettuccine so this chewed up brown watery crap most certainly did not belong in my meal. This place is vile and has gone incredibly down hill. I used to eat here all the time and regret that immensely. I'll make sure no one I know eats here again so they don't end up with some short cooks vomit in their food, too.

Very disappointed of this place! The service is really good, the food looks amazing but it doesn't have any taste! Is lack of flavor and texture, the pasta needs a good sauce, not just to throw some veggies on it. I definitely didn't like it!
Really really chewy sad pizza, it was the first time my husband and I couldn't finish one pie

I got a big bowl of salad from there and it was fresh and good. The price was obscure, but I can deal with it due to the salad being good. I did order guacamole and chips as an appetizer but never got it. I pointed this out and got a refund on that in the end.

I came here to place an order to go. First question. Is it for you?  I said: does it matter?  They said: yes I said: how come? They said: company policy. U can only order for yourself.  What if I wanted to order and take it with me to treat friends? They said: No What a dum policy!!!! Man, I just wanted food to go.

This place is the   for a chain. Maybe it's the vicinity next to that hellhole Chevy's Tex Mex, but they also always have fresh veggies and semi-healthy options. Anything thai-chicken is good and I like their margaritas. If you're really going in there for 'the best pizza on the planet' or some gourmet experience, you really need to get your head outta your butt.

So I walked in, and was immediately greeted warmly so that was a plus for us. After that our server promptly came. I ordered the pesto penne with chicken. It did not come out as hot as I wanted, but it was still good. The server did not come to the table that much to check on us. If the restaurant was busy, I would understand but it was pretty empty. Overall it was a good experience. Just some minor things that need improvement.
I love Italian Pizza the best but came here to American one;P Price: Good. $10-20 up to what you wanna drink and get extra. Taste: Better than i thought. Customer service: Not bad.

Maaan, I love CPK. It doesn't matter what state I'm in. If there's a CPK nearby, I'm happy. I have always been a huge fan of this location. Even though they closed the other location on Connecticut ave years ago. Throughout my dining timeline, I have had much of the menu. Not everything but the main courses and appetizers. I'm glad to see CPK has switched up its menu too. It's really a good spot for a meal that's good and inexpensive. I always get the Thin crust Jamaican Jerk Pizza. It's sweet-n-spicy, but with just enough oomph that you aren't grabbing antacids. It's the best flavored pizza to me.
Just visiting VA and I love this place! Everyone is exceptionally kind and will take the extra step for you.

Very disappointed . Me and my friends decided to have  dinner for the first time at this location . We walked in we asked the host for table of 3 . She said fellow me  , we went after her than she said opsss the    table is not clean . We had to go back to the front and waited for 10 min until they cleaned the table . Finally we got the table , our server  named  sony came with new waiter for training . We didn't mind  but she took the order and he supposed to write  the order on paper . They went behind us where the computer located ,They start yelling and blaiming each other  apprantely they forgot what we ordered .the waiter needs to be trained again instead of training someone else .she is unprofessional and couldn't memorize our order even if the guy missed up she should remembered the staff that we ordered . After 10 min of   drama show with the new guy , She came back again to the table and asked for the order . We gave the order we asked for Caesar salad with shrimp and humus as appetizer and 3 pizzas as main courses. We got everything at the same time we couldn't' find space for all plates .  Salad is good , humus is horrible it's feels like they put double portion of lemon juice to fake the freshness . 2 pizzas are ok , 1 of the pizzas supposed to come with garlic  and thin crust , the garlic is missing and the crust is dry and overcooked . The server didn't checked on us , she came after 15 min asked is everything was ok . We complained about humus and the missing topping of the  pizza . She took them off the check and taught us lesson how to complain next time , she said it's too late to complain because we re done eating she can't offer something else lol , she forgot that we haven't seen her around the hole  time . Over all  it looks like they have management problem , It's  sounds and looked like a  "circus "!!!!!!  Expensive , bad service , bad food, bad decor like a  flea  market . wouldn't recommend it to anyone in life :(

CPK is a fairly large chain and it shows with its menu and consistent ambience. This location is up to par with the others. I am only giving three stars because I believe the food strives to be unique and gourmet but fails to be rich in any flavor. It is however a "safe bet" if you are not wanting to risk something new.
Seriously took over 20min to get a beer and a lemonade.... I been to other CPK, and they're great, but this one is completely disappointing... And forget about having good costumer service
It's ok. Good service, tvs at the bar. I don't know why but it's like they're missing some good food at the Manu.  Beer at the bar is also nice
Love the five cheese pizza and jambalaya recommend the mojito and the sangria service is good and so is the atmosphere in the summer for the outdoors.

Definitely one of my favorite place for a good pizza.!! Place it's always nice and clean and stuff it's very friendly. My friend and I had lunch on Tuesday afternoon and our waiter David was very friendly and polite. He was such a sweet guy.! Margaritas are the best so good.!

We just had dinner there and when we were almost through eating, my son had to use the potty.  When we came back, our table was totally cleared out.  Our waiter and host were aghast and offered to prepare us our meals again to take back with us.  They prepared a new batch of Mac & cheese for my son since he had only eaten half of it.  It was a kind and generous gesture and they even comped us for part of our meal and beverage.  Since we felt so good leaving the restaurant, we decided to pay the generosity forward and offered the hot meal to a homeless man asking for money.  He didn't hesitate to take the hot meal from us.  We love going to this CA Pizza location for the great service and is my son's favorite place to eat!

I've been eating at CPK since I could eat. I'm not sure if it's always been on the east coast but as a CA native, it was always within a 15-minute drive. I have seen it develop and essentially re-brand over the years. I remember the days with their bright yellow menus, when they would bring out sliced bread with butter and I would order "corkscrew" pasta with butter or a traditional cheese pizza for dinner. Now, they bring out bread with olive oil and I order things like mahi mahi tacos (which are quite delicious!). The menu and decor have evolved over the years, and while I wouldn't call it an upscale restaurant, it's more upscale than it used to be. I don't mind the changes but I can sometimes be nostalgic for the past. One thing I really love about this location is the photos on the wall. They have stunning metal photo prints of California and Washington, DC landmarks. They probably do this at other locations, switching out the DC photos for whatever locale in which the restaurant is located, but I think it's a super nice touch.  The pizza and pasta remain delicious. I don't often stray from what I know but everytime I have (like with the mahi mahi tacos referenced above) it's been a good decision. This restaurant will always be a staple to me, no matter where it is.

CPK made me check my pizza snobbery.  Their margarita pizza was damn near perfect. Thin, flavorful dough - tons of fresh moz - fresh basil - it was everything. It was also huge. I'll be back to try more!

Great service!!!!  We were seated promptly; order taken appropriately; and provided excellent service.  I didn't care for my meal at all - Thai Pizza - too sweet for dinner. My server asked if I enjoyed my meal, to which I said no.  She was willing to change my order, to which I said no, I'll finish the meal.  To my surprise the manager decided to comp the meal even though I completed it.  Great service.

So apparently I'm already regular here :) It is a fact that i love pizza!  However i like this place because they also a lot of other options- this time i tried the new ribeye and it was delicious! However too bad that they didn't have french fries, but they have a draft beer so I'm totally fine :))

Who doesn't love CPK!!!!! The pizzas, salads, appetizers, and non-alcoholic beverages are very good. I actually like this location, great customer service and food is on point. The Butte Cake though, MY LORD!!! Oh and they have a rewards program as well.
Absolutely delicious brussel sprout and smoked bacon flatbread as well as Margarita pizza.  Excellent service.  Can't wait to go back and try other things.

Must say, I'm impressed by this CPK. I hadn't been to one in like 10 tears, then came to a kids bday here and they were great. They even remembered us the next time we came in.  The wild mushroom pizza is pretty good, as well as their Jamaican jerk pizza. Haven't tried them all, but so far so good. Edie, the manager, was super nice, as was Sabrina.  I recommend this place to eat and to have ur kids bday.
I love their chicken pizza with pineapple!!!! Their full size salad is also super big and good. I missed the pizza there so much! My friend and I both want to come back the second time:)

For nearly 10 years, I have been a frequent flyer at CPK.  I even visited CPK in Denver, Colorado during recent travel (July 2016).  I love the ambiance of the establishment.  And meals are prepared with deliciously, fresh ingredients.  Like most businesses, there are always changes.  Although I truly miss the Field Greens Salad and Poblano Pepper, I continue to enjoy the butter cake and modify existing entrees to suit my taste.  They deliver within a 5 mile radius of the Pentagon City location.  And some food delivery vendors will CPK pick up orders for delivery.  They show a variety of programming (news and sports) on tvs at the bar.  Casual atmosphere.  And conveniently located just steps from the Pentagon City Metro Station.

I've never been a fan of California Pizza Kitchen, which is why I usually stir clear from it. I hadn't been in years and I was recently reminded why I stayed away for so long.  Alas, I found myself dinning here (not by choice) for a work meeting. I'm a firm believer that when you visit an establishment and they specialize in a specific food, you should order it, hence the reason I ordered a pizza. All the pizzas are personal size, so I ordered the pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza. The pizza was just okay.  The sauce was bland, the crust was unmemorable and the pizza as a whole just seemed to be missing something....flavor, yeah...that's it. The service was pretty good, and our server was attentive, but nothing really stood out to me.  What's funny is, I've purchased California Pizza Kitchen frozen pizzas from the grocery store and those seem to have more flavor in them, than the pizza I ordered that night.  Oh well...on another note, we did get a lot of work accomplished.
The menu is great. Always Enjoy going for lunch.  and the nice staff.  But today terribly annoyed by staff asking our party 2x if we gave to their fund raising activities.

Poor cleanliness and extra slow service. I think when they get busy they get sloopy with food preparation. No hand washing not using gloves and handling money and food. Dont sit at counter during lunch hour. Waited for over 30 mins for food.

I can understand slow service or lack thereof if it was a rush. But there were only about 6 people in the place, with more than enough waiters/waitress for everyone. It took 15 minutes to bring out 2 lemonades, and seem more interested in hanging out and joking around with each other and another man that was just hanging out in front of the restaurant. Food was good, but not worth the service.

I had been here for a few Happy Hours (drinks only) and ordered delivery once, however I had not fully dined at  CPK until Veteran's Day this year. As a Veteran, I heard they were participating in providing a free entrée for Vets, so my BF and a friend decided to stop by. I was very impressed that they had the Fallen Comrade Table set up in the entrance to honor the fallen, missing, or imprisoned military service-members. Honestly, this speaks highly of the establishment and I plan to dine here more often in the future. When we arrived, we were seated right away. We had Brenda as our server and she was friendly and attentive. For the appetizer we order the Avocado Club Egg Rolls which were phenomenal and perfectly fried. Even my not-easily-impressed BF said that he is going to order these every time we come. For the entrees, we ordered The Original BBQ Chicken and Five Cheese Fresh Tomato Pizza. They were both delicious and a lot bigger than I expected. My friend ordered the Thai Crunch salad, and it looked and tasted amazing. It was seriously the most delicious looking salad I had ever seen. Next time I am definitely ordering one. For the cocktail I had the Beehive Sangria. It was tasty and very refreshing. It did take us a while to get our check (due to CC machine issues) but otherwise a great dining experience. I will definitely be back :).

I had to come write a review about the Butter Cake I had here this week, TWICE! lol I've had their Pizza several times which is always very good but I am also pleased with many of their other dishes. The spinach dip, the lemon herb chicken breast dish, and many of their salads are great! They don't have a big menu like post places but everything I've had had been great! Their sangrias are a MUST HAVE along with their BUTTER CAKE! If you love a good dessert like myself their butter cake is hands down one of the best desserts in the DC area! Anytime I go it's never crowded and always pretty quiet.

Waiters and staff who constantly "check up" on you to see if everything is ok sends two messages to guests.  One; you're trying to get a good tip.  Two; you're not trained well in the art of waiting.  It's extremely annoying to have wait staff constantly do this. And that needs to change about this place. Maybe some people don't mind constantly being interrupted while you're talking to a friend who's sitting across from you but I don't. Once around the beginning when you've began eating your meal and once after the check is given. Let your guests do their thing. Let them have a conversation, it otherwise completely defeats the purpose of having a friend with you to eat at an establishment.  The food... Well its basic Italian, and it's ok. Nothing to write home to mom about. It's not bad at all, but only ok.

I like my pizza with a lot of cheese and meat. It came with very little of both. I was not exactly happy. They covered it up with a lot of spinach which was okay but it seemed like I asked for a veggie pizza which I didnt

CPK is one chain I actually go to and enjoy, but why oh why do they always have such terrible service? Tonight was no different at Pentagon City CPK and probably one of the slowest service I've ever experienced. Our server, Dylan, was so forgetful or just plain bad at his job, it was ridiculous. He brings water glasses filled to the brim, but no straws. 20 minutes later he brings the lemonade and still no bread. Understandably, the kitchen was backed up due to a large party, but all we wanted were drinks and bread. Parties that arrived after us seemed to get everything before us.  When you have to ask 5 times for bread, something's gotta be wrong. It took close to 40 minutes before we were served just bread and olive oil. The entrees came much later. He was so SLOW. It honestly wasn't that crowded on a Monday night, as there were plenty of empty tables, minus the one large party. I'm not sure what the hold up was, but the service was horrific from beginning to end. We were cutting it close in time and needed a box for the pizza. When we asked another server who happened to walk by our table, she straight out refused to help us. She could have at least acknowledge our request, but instead she rudely dismissed us with a rude stare and asked who our server was. She waited until our server was in sight and directed him towards us instead. Really, you couldn't just give us a box? Is it that difficult?  I did forget my credit card after paying, and our server was nice enough to run after us to return the card. I appreciated that, but unfortunately it didn't help to mend the terrible experience I just had.  Lesson learned. Take out it is.

I'm so very disappointed. I've been here a million times but am unsure if I'll ever come back. What's happened to this place? It's not very busy here right now and I'm here. Party of one. I just came for a cheese pizza and ginger ale- I'm easy.  The hostess was clearly angry that people on her mic weren't answering her on where to seat me. After a few minutes of this, she sat me. After people being served all around me, I finally after 5 minutes went back to the hostess to ask who my waitress was. The hostess took my order. Several minutes later a waitress came, did not apologiZe or even say who she was, and handed me a ginger ale. She never checked on me again. She handed me a pizza- no longer hot- without a word, and I didn't get a chance to ask her to refill my completely empty ginger ale. It took me a few minutes to flag her down after that and I asked. Please keep in mind that I've been nothing if not pleasant to her. But then before getting my drink she loudly started complaining to another waitress about the hostess overbooking her section. She's continued to stand there now for 20 minutes talking to other waitresses and I've yet been asked how I'm doing or if I need anything. I'm not sure how I'll get the check.  I waited to post the review so I could add the name of the waitress: SABRINA. She did finally come over and ask if I wanted a box.  Super disappointed. This is where I usually eat dinner when I go to this mall but I guess no longer.

When traveling with a large group I always tend to sway towards chains. I've been to several CPK before with groups but none have been as accomodating as this one. When we arrived they already had our table set up and had even put out the bread. That quickly quieted the kids in the group who where starving. Drinks were on par, if not a little pricey in my opinion. Soups were tasty and inviting after being out in the cold. Would definatley recommend to anyone in the area. BTW, parking is validated for up to an hour.

I came here for lunch. The place wasn't packed and we were seated right away.  Our server was prompt and courteous. He gave us a few minutes to go over the menu and then took our order. I ordered the Basil Pesto Pasta with chicken and shrimp. The food arrived quickly but I was a bit disappointed with the ratio of chicken and shrimp to the pasta. I found myself searching for the chicken and finding only pasta.  On a more positive note the flavors were there but since you pay extra to add meat I expected to well you know...see and taste the meat. Meh, it was an experience for sure. If I'm in the area I'd definitely come again and maybe try another signature dish.

good pizza shop. gluten free crusts available. they normally skimp on toppings so it's worth 2$ extra to get a normally topped pizza. recommend the bbq chicken pizza. second visit with still no problems

Shared a BBQ chicken pizza with my wife on our first visit to this place. More laid back so don't expect fast service. While this probably doesn't rate on my top ten list we will probably try it again.

No wait on a Friday night! It's a chain, but still pretty good. I had the mushroom pasta which was ok. My husband had the tostado pizza which was pretty good, a little spicy. My kids had mac n cheese, as expected, and they ate it.

So I frequent this place a lot. The service is never really that great but I enjoy the food tremendously. I placed a Togo order today, and I assume the managers were having their manager meeting (I'm in the restaurant industry so I know a manager meeting and the terms used in one) and I hear one of the managers say "that's because bitch's talk too much" Not really an appropriate thing to say around/in front of guest.  Aside from that, I go to pay for my Togo order and I leave the cashier a $6 tip on a $30 Togo order and he never said "thank you" Again, I work in the industry and know that most people don't even tip on Togo orders. This place needs a revamp of staff. I only give it 3 stars because the food is delicious.

This location was ok, The food was pretty much normal but I admit the location is a bit run down. The service is a bit above average. It's a bit noisy. If I had my choice I'd pick the one in Tysons corner over this location.

Ask for Sabrina she rocks!  Sabrina is very prompt and amazing. She's the best waitress me and my twin sister Lee have ever had. Thank you so much for your awesome service. Service that's this great forces us to come back. See you soon Sabrina !!!
Large attractive restaurant with many booths. Delicious Kung Pao spaghetti! Yum. Worth the money.
Great delivery service it came pretty quick and it was still hot. I really enjoyed it.
Food took over 2 hours to arrive. I hate to contact Eat24 to find out if it was even coming. When it arrived it was not hot and the pizza dough was a little stale.

We were in town sightseeing and we met one of my son's former class mates here - she lives just across the street so it was very convenient for us.  The server was very friendly and very patient with us, as with visited a good bit before we ordered. The food was delicious! Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower, Szechwan Chicken Dumplings, BBQ Pizza and the Crispy Fish Tacos were our choices and they did not disappoint! My saddest part - there's not a California Pizza in Mississippi! If our travels find us back in that area, we will be back!

I know it's a chain restaurant, but they have a pretty good lunch special. Between $9 to $11, you get a combination of 2 items, whether that be pizza, soup, salad, or sandwich. I had the Sedona Tortilla soup which has tomatoes, mild green chilies, spices, and crispy tortillas. It has a little bit of a zip to it, but still found it to be flavorful and not overwhelming. I also had the super spinach & quinoa salad with grilled chicken. There were granny smith apples, marinated cranberries, spiced pecan, and a champagne vinaigrette. It was the right combination of ingredients and enjoyable. Felt like a healthy meal and I was feeling good afterwords.  Service was everything I hoped it would be. Our waitress checked up on us several times, brought over the food in a timely fashion, and refilled my water on a consistent basis. This is a good place to go to with the family. I wouldn't take a date here, but definitely a solid lunch option in the Pentagon City neighborhood.

I really wish I could give ZERO stars!!! This CPK is well below the usual not so great corporate CPK standard! Food quality is well below the typical not so great CPK corporate standard. And don't even get me started on service! For some reason, the less than clever manager has the bartender not only tending bar and providing food service for the bar customers, but also taking drink and food orders, as well as, running food to tables in the dining area!!! What?!?!?! How STUPID is that??? Question:  how long should it take for chicken fettuccine in a half-full restaurant? 10 minutes? NOPE!! 15 minutes? YEAH RIGHT, that would be like light speed for this CPK!! 20 minutes? NO WAY!! 25 minutes?? I can't tell you because I walked out after 20 minutes and no food in sight!! Conclusion - DO NOT EAT at this CPK!! Find another restaurant in the area, you have lots of choices.

Two favorites here, the Thai Chicken Crunch salad and the Jamaican Jerk Pizza.  Service has typically been good, not necessarily great, but consistently good.  I'd skip the patio unless you enjoy looking at buses.

I don't know what it is, but this CPK has beat every chain that I've been to in CALIFORNIA. The servers are really friendly and easy to talk to, the food comes out spectacular every time, and I also have the greatest company and talks whenever I'm here. I love the pesto pasta, and the California Club pizza. The eggrolls are also amazing, and I can't get enough of the pink ranch sauce that it comes with. MMMM, so good.  Also, I don't go out drinking at restaurants very often, but they have this strawberry/honey sangria that is just out of this world - it's dangerous though, because you can't taste the alcohol. It is absolutely delicious, and I'd recommend it every time (especially if you don't like the TASTE of alcohol). I am definitely coming back here. It's my favorite place to go after shopping around at Fashion Center.
Disgusting ripoff. I three it away and made scrambled aggs. Just AWFUL and $58 for very small portions of exceptionally bad food.
